featured.text: One of the first European books to be printed in movable type was Johannes Gutenberg's 42-line Bible.
Systems using movable arms were popular in Chicago, while those using the red and green lights were adopted in San Francisco.
The use of movable type was first introduced by (A) William Caxton.

other.text: The first English book printed in movable type was (A) done from wood blocks one letter at a time.
According to the passage, the use of movable type was considered as a "great step forward" because (A) it did not need a lot of wood.
A great step forward was the use of movable type.
Thus, he proposed a signaling system based on the railway movable-arm signal:

definition.zh_def: 可移動的，能夠被移動或改變位置的。
definition.en_def: Able to be moved from one place to another.
definition.example: The furniture in the room is movable, making it easy to rearrange.
